shortDescription: Triggered when the touchscreen stops being touched.
notes: The identifier is only guaranteed to be unique for the specific touch press until touchreleased is triggered with that identifier, at which point it may be reused for new touch presses.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The identifier for the touch press.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The x-axis position of the touch press inside the window, in pixels.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The y-axis position of the touch press inside the window, in pixels.

arguments.name: dx
arguments.description: The x-axis movement of the touch press inside the window, in pixels.

arguments.name: dy
arguments.description: The y-axis movement of the touch press inside the window, in pixels.

arguments.name: pressure
arguments.description: The amount of pressure being applied. Most touch screens aren't pressure sensitive, in which case the pressure will be 1.
